title: NASA Founded
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) was established by the U.S. government to lead space exploration efforts.

title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
description: Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin became the first humans to walk on the Moon.

title: Voyager 1 Launched
description: Voyager 1 began its journey to explore the outer planets and is now the farthest human-made object from Earth.

title: Hubble Space Telescope Launched
description: Hubble was launched into orbit to capture high-resolution images of deep space, revolutionizing astronomy.

title: Curiosity Rover Lands on Mars
description: NASA's Curiosity rover landed in Gale Crater to investigate Mars' climate and geology.

title: James Webb Space Telescope Launched
description: The JWST launched to observe the universe in infrared and study the formation of galaxies, stars, and planets.

title: Artemis I Launch
description: Artemis I was NASA's first mission to the Moon since Apollo, testing the SLS and Orion spacecraft.
